awd_titl_txt: Instrumentation for Communications and Signal Processing    Laboratory
awd_abstract_narration: California State University, Chico, will establish a communications and         digital signal processing laboratory for undergraduate electrical               engineering students. Major instruments to be purchased are two                 computer-based telephone branch exchanges, five microcomputers, three           instruments for communication signal analysis (protocol analyzer, signal        analyzer and high speed oscilloscope/digitizer), and four digital signal        processing/analog interface boards.  This equipment will be combined            with existing basic laboratory instruments to provide a laboratory              component for five undergraduate engineering courses.  Digital                  communications and signal processing are rapidly growing technical              areas; this project will provide students with the laboratory experience        needed to prepare them for further study in graduate school or                  professional work in industry.
